name: Benchling
headline: Unlocking the power of biotech with modern software for modern science
description:
Biotechnology is rewriting life as we know it, from the medicines we take, to the crops we grow, the materials we wear, and the household goods that we rely on every day. Biotech R&D is radically transforming our world, but to move at the new speed of science, scientists need better technology.

Benchling’s mission is to unlock the power of biotechnology. The world’s biotech leaders and innovators use our R&D Cloud to power the development of breakthrough products and accelerate time to milestone and market.

# Set the new speed of R&D
[Request a demo](http://benchling.com/</request-demo>)
![Sanofi](http://benchling.com/assets/images/sanofi.png)
![Moderna](http://benchling.com/assets/images/moderna.png)
![Beam](http://benchling.com/assets/images/Beam.png)
![Novonesis](http://benchling.com/assets/images/Novonesis.png)
![Altos](http://benchling.com/assets/images/Altos.png)
## Why teams choose Benchling
### Digitize your lab, automate workflows, and increase productivity with AI
Plan, record, and share experiments using a collaborative, cloud-based notebook.
Cut manual and repetitive work with automated workflows and analytics.
Use AI tools to work more efficiently.
[Read more](http://benchling.com/</bioresearch>)
### Build a data foundation that fits your unique science
Model and track scientific data for biomolecules, small molecules, cell lines, animals, reagents, and more.
Design a unified data model across experiments to power computational science.
[Read more](http://benchling.com/</registry>)
### Evolve with your R&D on an open, flexible platform
Access out-of-the-box integrations, build custom apps, and connect data from instruments, software, and beyond.
Scale on a secure, flexible platform that adapts to your science and ecosystem.
[Read more](http://benchling.com/</platform>)

generated_description:
Benchling is a San Francisco-based company founded in 2012, and it’s a product of Y Combinator's Batch S12. At its core, Benchling aims to revolutionize biotechnology through modern software designed to match the pace of contemporary research and development (R&D). With a team of around 750 employees, Benchling serves as a vital tool for biotech leaders and innovators across the globe.

The company's mission centers on unlocking the potential of biotechnology, enabling scientists to drive breakthroughs in various areas—from pharmaceuticals to agricultural innovations. Their comprehensive R&D Cloud facilitates smarter and faster product development, making it crucial for entities looking to shorten their time to milestone and market.

Here’s what makes Benchling compelling:

1. **Digitization and Automation**: They offer a collaborative, cloud-based notebook that allows researchers to plan, record, and share experiments more efficiently. Their automated workflows drastically reduce the time spent on menial tasks.
  
2. **Data Structuring**: With Benchling, you can model and track scientific data across a spectrum of biological entities—be it biomolecules or cell lines—creating a unified data structure for computational science.

3. **Flexible Platform**: The platform is designed to evolve with your R&D needs. It boasts out-of-the-box integrations and the capacity to build custom applications, adapting seamlessly to diverse scientific requirements.

Benchling currently supports sectors such as biopharmaceuticals, industrial biotech, and agritech, offering specialized solutions for fields like gene therapy and RNA therapeutics. What’s impressive is that over 200,000 scientists—including a sizable number from prestigious biopharma companies—are already leveraging Benchling's capabilities.

The company emphasizes user support, providing services that blend expertise in both software and science, which sets it apart. Benchling Learning Labs empower teams with skills development and certification options.

To put it simply, Benchling is bridging the gap between modern science and technological advancement. If you want to learn more, you can visit their website at [benchling.com](http://benchling.com).
